column1: Art Institute of Chicago////We entered the museum on the north side
column2: which faces Millenium Park. This entry point was also helpful in quickly getting us to the spaces we wanted to visit. The building is huge
column3: so if you plan on doing Modern European first I'd recommend entering in the modern wing. Admission was $25/person. There was no line for tickets (lucky us!). As you enter the modern wing you have the opportunity to check your coat ($1/item for non-members and worth it
column4: in my opinion) and get an audio guide ($7 for non-members) and a museum map (free) - all on the right hand side of the atrium.
